member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ApplicationSwitch
member.summary: App switch key. Should bring up the application switcher dialog (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Bookmark
member.summary: Bookmark key. On some TV remotes, bookmarks content or web pages (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Explorer
member.summary: Explorer special function key. Used to launch a browser application (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Camera
member.summary: Camera key. Used to launch a camera application or take pictures (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Focus
member.summary: Camera Focus key. Used to focus the camera (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.HeadsetHook
member.summary: Headset Hook key. Used to hang up calls and stop media (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Settings
member.summary: The settings key. Starts the system settings activity (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.SoftLeft
member.summary: The soft left key. Usually situated below the display on phones and used as a multi-function feature key for selecting a software defined function shown on the bottom left of the display (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.SoftRight
member.summary: The soft right key. Usually situated below the display on phones and used as a multi-function feature key for selecting a software defined function shown on the bottom right of the display (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Symbol
member.summary: The symbol modifier key. Used to enter alternate symbols (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.PictureSymbols
member.summary: The picture symbols modifier key. Used to switch symbol sets (Emoji, Kao-moji) (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.SwitchCharset
member.summary: The switch charset modifier key. Used to switch character sets (Kanji, Katakana) (Android).

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.AVRInput
member.summary: The A/V Receiver input key. On TV remotes, switches the input mode on an external A/V Receiver (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.AVRPower
member.summary: The A/V Receiver power key. On TV remotes, toggles the power on an external A/V Receiver (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Captions
member.summary: The toggle captions key. Switches the mode for closed-captioning text, for example during television shows (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ChannelDown
member.summary: The channel down key. On TV remotes, decrements the television channel (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ChannelUp
member.summary: The channel up key. On TV remotes, increments the television channel (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.DVR
member.summary: The DVR key. On some TV remotes, switches to a DVR mode for recorded shows (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Guide
member.summary: The guide key. On TV remotes, shows a programming guide(Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Info
member.summary: The info key. Common on TV remotes to show additional information related to what is currently being viewed(Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ProgBlue
member.summary: The blue "programmable" key. On TV remotes, acts as a contextual/programmable key (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ProgGreen
member.summary: The green "programmable" key. On TV remotes, acts as a contextual/programmable key (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ProgRed
member.summary: The red "programmable" key. On TV remotes, acts as a contextual/programmable key (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.ProgYellow
member.summary: The yellow "programmable" key. On TV remotes, acts as a contextual/programmable key (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.STBInput
member.summary: The set-top-box input key. On TV remotes, switches the input mode on an external set-top-box (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.STBPower
member.summary: The set-top-box power key. On TV remotes, toggles the power on an external Set-top-box (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.TV
member.summary: The TV key. On TV remotes, switches to viewing live TV (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.TVInput
member.summary: The TV input key. On TV remotes, switches the input on a television screen (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.TVPower
member.summary: The TV power key. On TV remotes, toggles the power on a television screen (Android)

member.name: F:Engine.EKeys.Window
member.summary: The window key. On TV remotes, toggles picture-in-picture mode or other windowing functions (Android)

member.name: T:Engine.KeyEvent
member.summary: Provides data for the or event.

member.name: M:Engine.KeyEvent.#ctor(Engine.EKeys)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Engine.KeyEvent.SuppressKeyPress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the key event should be passed on to the underlying control.

member.name: M:Engine.KeyPressEvent.#ctor(System.Char)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The ASCII character corresponding to the key the user pressed.

member.name: P:Engine.KeyPressEvent.KeyChar
member.summary:
Gets the character corresponding to the key pressed.
The ASCII character that is composed. For example, if the user presses SHIFT + K, this property returns an uppercase K.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.Spring
member.summary: The force increases in proportion to the distance of the axis from a defined neutral point. This is Condition force.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.Damper
member.summary: The force increases in proportion to the velocity with which the user moves the axis. This is Condition force.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.Inertia
member.summary: The force increases in proportion to the acceleration of the axis. This is Condition force.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.Friction
member.summary: The force is applied when the axis is moved and depends on the defined friction coefficient. This is Condition force.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.ConstantForce
member.summary: A constant force is a force with a defined magnitude and duration.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.SawtoothUp
member.summary: The waveform drops vertically after it reaches maximum positive force. This is Periodic force.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.SawtoothDown
member.summary: The waveform rises vertically after it reaches maximum negative force. This is Periodic force.

member.name: F:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffectTypes.Ramp
member.summary: A ramp force is a force with defined starting and ending magnitudes and a finite duration. A ramp force can continue in a single direction, or it can start as a strong push in one direction, weaken, stop, and then strengthen in the opposite direction.

member.name: M:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffect.SetDirection(System.Single[])
member.summary: Normalized vector conformable to the axes. For single-axis may be null.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffect.Direction
member.summary: Normalized vector conformable to the axes. For single-axis must be null.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackEffect.Duration
member.summary: The total duration of the effect, in seconds.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConstantForceEffect.Magnitude
member.summary: The magnitude of the effect, in the range from -1 through 1.
member.remarks: If an envelope is applied to this effect, the value represents the magnitude of the sustain. If no envelope is applied, the value represents the amplitude of the entire effect.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConditionEffect.Offset
member.summary: Offset for the condition, in the range from -1 through 1.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConditionEffect.PositiveCoefficient
member.summary: Coefficient constant on the positive side of the offset, in the range from -1 through 1.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConditionEffect.NegativeCoefficient
member.summary: Coefficient constant on the negative side of the offset, in the range from -1 through 1. If the device does not support separate positive and negative coefficients, the value of NegativeCoefficient is ignored, and the value of PositiveCoefficient is used as both the positive and negative coefficients.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConditionEffect.PositiveSaturation
member.summary: Maximum force output on the positive side of the offset, in the range from 0 through 1. If the device does not support force saturation, the value of this member is ignored.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConditionEffect.NegativeSaturation
member.summary: Maximum force output on the negative side of the offset, in the range from 0 through 1. If the device does not support force saturation, the value of this member is ignored.
member.remarks: If the device does not support separate positive and negative saturation, the value of NegativeSaturation is ignored, and the value of PositiveSaturation is used as both the positive and negative saturation.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackConditionEffect.DeadBand
member.summary: Region around Offset in which the condition is not active, in the range from 0 through 1. In other words, the condition is not active between Offset minus DeadBand and Offset plus DeadBand.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackPeriodicEffect.Magnitude
member.summary: Magnitude of the effect, in the range from 0 through 1. If an envelope is applied to this effect, the value represents the magnitude of the sustain. If no envelope is applied, the value represents the amplitude of the entire effect.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackPeriodicEffect.Offset
member.summary: Offset of the effect. The range of forces generated by the effect is minus to Offset plus . The value of the member is also the baseline for any envelope that is applied to the effect.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackPeriodicEffect.Phase
member.summary: Position in the cycle of the periodic effect at which playback begins, in the range from 0 through 1.
member.remarks: A device driver cannot provide support for all values in the member. In this case, the value is rounded off to the nearest supported value.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackPeriodicEffect.Period
member.summary: Period of the effect, in seconds.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackRampEffect.StartForce
member.summary: Magnitude at the start of the effect, in the range from -1 through 1.

member.name: P:Engine.ForceFeedbackRampEffect.EndForce
member.summary: Magnitude at the end of the effect, in the range from -1 through 1.

member.name: T:Engine.InputEvent
member.summary: Describes general input event. Custom events should be generalized from this one.

member.name: T:Engine.EngineInitialization
